byline.contributor: Rod Nordland reported from Baghdad, and Peter Baker from Washington. Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and an Iraqi employee of The New York Times from Salahuddin Province.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and PETER BAKER

abstract: American airstrikes come to aid of Iraqi security forces and Shiite militias leading assault against Islamic State militants in Tikrit, Iraq; American intervention is effort to seize initiative from Iran, which had taken lead role in operations against Islamic State; American officials say Pres Obama made the call to join in attack, after staying on the sidelines during three-week offensive, when Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi agreed to let Iranian-backed Shiite militias move aside.
lead_paragraph: American warplanes began airstrikes against Islamic State positions in the Iraqi city, aiding a three-week offensive by a coalition of Shiite militias and Iraqi security forces.

headline.main: Opening New Iraq Front, U.S. Strikes ISIS in Tikrit
headline.print_headline: Opening New Iraq Front, U.S. Strikes ISIS in Tikrit

snippet: American warplanes began airstrikes against Islamic State positions in the Iraqi city, aiding a three-week offensive by a coalition of Shiite militias and Iraqi security forces.
